title: go.tools/cmd/oracle: usage goes to stdout, flag help to stderr
body:
by **patrick.allen.higgins**: 
Run oracle -help 2>/dev/null

You'll see:

Go source code oracle.
Usage: oracle [<flag> ...] <mode> <args> ...
...
Flags:


Then run oracle -help >/dev/null

You'll see:

Run 'oracle -help' for more information.
  -cpuprofile="": write cpu profile to file
  -format="plain": Output format.  One of {plain,json,xml}.
  -pos="": Filename and byte offset or extent of a syntax element about which to query, e.g. foo.go:#123,#456, bar.go:#123.
  -ptalog="": Location of the points-to analysis log file, or empty to disable logging.
  -reflect=true: Analyze reflection soundly (slow).


This is using go.tools changeset 563:ff244233638e.
